manifests.description: A set of kubernetes manifest files which demonstrates how a perisisten volume claim can be used. In this example, a persistent volume is created backed by an azure disk. This persistent volume is then used in a persistent volume claim by explicitly specifying the persistent volume name in the volumeName field. Finally, this persistent volume claim is used in a pod definition. The pod definition specifies the persistent volume claim to be used by specifying the persistentVolumeClaim spec section.

A set of kubernetes manifest files which demonstrates how a pod can communicate with another pod. In this example, a pod that runs redis is created. This particular example does not use statefulsets for the redis pod though. A service is also created that would expose the redis service internally within the cluster using a ClusterIP. Then, a pod that runs a .net core worker is created that communicates with the redis pod using the service name and the port number.
A set of kubernetes manifest files which demonstrates how a cron job can be created and run using a .net core worker. In this example, the worker simply prints the environment variables and exits.
A set of kubernetes manifest files which demonstrates stateful sets. In this example a MySQL server is setup with 3 replicas.
